page.title: 08Somers Road and Elm Grove
page.content: {Somers Road}runs, NE to SW, straight for half a kilometre. To the east are pre-1900 terraced housing and on the west are blocks of concrete flats, rebuilt after World War II bombing. Although owners/usage change rapidly, a community atmosphere exists. The building of{Winston Churchill Ave}has cut{Somers Road}in half and altered its importance as a transport route. {Elm Grove,}with a morning rush of bikes, cars, buses and pedestrians, is a busy shopping thoroughfare. O.A.P. flats have been built and named after previous villas. In the centre, modern shops, with flats above, front onto the street, while in the east, older 1930's single-storey shops sit in front of older houses. Through time, a drop in population density is evident. -Form 4H Grove Middle School
